text: Retail Pharmacy Store - Coupon & Promotions Policy Manufacturer Coupons  Only one manufacturer coupon per item purchased.  Coupons must be valid and not expired.  Digital coupons must be loaded to customer account before checkout. Store Coupons  Multiple store coupons may apply if terms allow.  Coupon stacking permitted only when manufacturer and store coupons differ. Restrictions  Coupons cannot exceed item value.  Photocopied or altered coupons will not be accepted.  Manager approval required for transactions exceeding $100 in coupon value.

Retail Pharmacy Store - Inventory Management Policy Stock Monitoring  Daily review of top-selling SKUs and low stock alerts.  Automatic reorder triggered when days-of-supply falls below 7 days. Receiving Shipments  Verify shipment quantities against purchase order.  Report discrepancies within 24 hours. Stockout Prevention  Escalate items with repeated stockouts to district manager.  Maintain safety stock for high-demand products.

Retail Pharmacy Store - Loss Prevention & Shrink Control Policy Theft Prevention  High-value items must be secured in locked display cases.  Perform daily cycle counts on controlled inventory. Internal Controls  Employees must follow dual-control procedures for safe access.  Random audits conducted monthly. Incident Reporting  All theft or fraud incidents must be reported within 24 hours.  Complete incident documentation and submit to corporate compliance.

Retail Pharmacy Store - Return & Refund Policy General Return Guidelines  Returns must be accompanied by a valid receipt within 30 days of purchase.  Items must be unopened and in original packaging unless defective.  Refunds will be issued to the original form of payment. Non-Returnable Items  Prescription medications once dispensed.  Open personal care items.  Gift cards and prepaid financial products. No-Receipt Returns  Customer must present valid government-issued ID.  Refund issued as store credit at lowest selling price in past 60 days.  Store reserves right to deny excessive no-receipt returns.

Retail Pharmacy Store - Opening & Closing Procedures Opening Procedures  Perform security walkthrough before unlocking doors.  Verify POS systems and registers are operational.  Confirm pharmacy compliance checklist completion. Closing Procedures  Reconcile all registers and secure cash in safe.  Lock pharmacy inventory cabinets.  Activate alarm system and verify all entry points are secured.
